definition: curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

sentences.english: As night fell, work went on by oil lamp and candlelight.
sentences.chinese: 夜幕降临时，僧侣们点起油灯和蜡烛，继续干活。

sentences.english: Later, as night fell over the tumultuous capital, gunfire could be heard in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 随后，夜幕降临骚乱的首都，远处传来枪声。

sentences.english: With dark shies you will notice the reddish color of Arcturus.
sentences.chinese: 当夜幕降临时，你会注意到那颗淡红色的大角星。

sentences.english: For sweet sleep which comes with night.
sentences.chinese: 为了夜幕降临时的甜酣。

sentences.english: So when darkness came, we walked slowly and soundlessly to the Midianites’ camp.
sentences.chinese: 于是当夜幕降临，我们悄悄的缓缓接近敌人的营地。

sentences.english: As night fell, she ran out of the castle, Jingzhi Zhao walked the dense forests.
sentences.chinese: 夜幕降临时，她跑出城堡，径直朝密林中走去。

sentences.english: Nightfall found him many miles short of his destination.
sentences.chinese: 当夜幕降临是，他离目的地还有好几英里呢。
夜幕降临，黑暗翩然而至。

sentences.english: So when darkness came, we walked slowly and soundlessly to the Midianites' camp.
sentences.chinese: 于是当夜幕降临，我们悄悄的缓缓接近敌人的营地。

sentences.english: The night sky was unwilling to remain out of the limelight, the crescent moon.
sentences.chinese: 夜幕降临，天空露出不甘寂寞的月牙。

sentences.english: As dusk fell, we seemed to face an uncertain future.
sentences.chinese: 当夜幕降临时，我们似乎面对一个不确定的未来。

sentences.english: And darkness falls in my eyes, and days are far from rosy now.
sentences.chinese: 当夜幕降临，白天失去玫瑰的美丽颜色的时候。

sentences.english: Night lowered its curtain and mantled the land.
And when night came she ran away and went straight into the woods.
sentences.chinese: 夜幕降临时，她跑出城堡，迳直朝密林中走去。

sentences.english: SunKangWhen night fell, Fuyang to light up.
sentences.chinese: 每当夜幕降临，富阳就亮起来了。

sentences.english: During the night, the older brother began to pour his rice into his younger brother's barrel.
sentences.chinese: 当夜幕降临，大哥开始将他的大米往小弟的桶里倒。

definition: early evening when lanterns are first lit
night scene/the dim light of night
the sun sets in the west (idiom)
(of a city etc) ablaze with lights
in the evening/when night falls/towards evening/at night fall/at dusk
